frameDefinitions: The Jury discuss the Case and its Charges in order to evaluate the  Possible_sentence of the accused.
This frame contains words referring to teaching and the participants in teaching.
The words in this frame have to do with a Speaker asking an Addressee a question which calls for a reply (as opposed to making a request which calls for an action on the part of the Addressee).  ''
This frame describes the process that involves the inquiry and determination by an authority, the Investigator, of the circumstances surrounding an Incident perpetrated by a Suspect.
A person, the Cognizer, thinks about a Topic over a period of time.
This frame concerns a Cognizer (a person or other intelligent being) paying close attention to something, the Ground, in order to discover and note its salient characteristics.
frameExamples: Dad <t>taught</t> me that if you work hard, you will be OK - no matter what happens.
We <t>asked</t> Ruby what kind of food they ate.
The police are <t>investigating</t> the bank's reported loss of several thousand dollars from their downtown branch's top security vault. DNI
The men were silently <t>mulling</t> <t>over</t> the proposition of committing an assassination
We <t>searched</t> the yard  for my contact lens.
listRoleDefinitions: The group that debates the case.
The legal label for the crime that the defendant is accused of.
The <fen>Case</fen> which a trial is convened to decide.
A sentence that the jury considers during deliberation.
When the deliberation takes place.
Where the deliberation takes place.
One who instructs a <fen>Student</fen> in some area of knowledge or skill.
One who is instructed by a <fen>Teacher</fen> in skills or knowledge.
An educational establishment, such as a school or college.
The area of knowledge or skill which is taught by a <fen>Teacher</fen> or to a <fen>Student</fen>.
A formal Qualification such as an academic degree or a certificate for which a student is aiming.
An action which the <fen>Student</fen> is able to perform as a result of instruction.
A guideline for correct behavior. In most cases, this concerns morally or socially desirable actions.
A piece of information that the <fen>Student</fen> is informed of by the <fen>Teacher</fen>.
Educational <fen>Material</fen>, such as books, tapes, or videos, used by a <fen>Teacher</fen> or a <fen>Student</fen> to acquire skills or knowledge.
A role, typically professional or vocational,  that the <fen>Student</fen> is meant to be able to fill as a result of their training.
FN: a program of lectures or other matter dealing with a subject
The time when the teaching occurs.

The <fen>Place</fen> is the location within which the teaching takes place.

Consider whether a possible <fen>Place</fen> phrase is really where the training took place or is rather part of a description of the <fen>Institution</fen>.
The person asking a question generally occurs as the External Argument of verb and noun targets:

The Addressee is most frequently the NP Object of a target verb.  However, with the verb <ment>inquire</ment>, Addressee can only occur as an <ment>of</ment>-PP and with a noun target, Addressee occurs in a PP Complement or as a possessive :
The Message, or content of the question, usually takes the form of a direct quote or an embedded question with a verb target:
Topic occurs very frequently in this frame with both noun and verb targets. It generally occurs as a PP Complement:
The time at which the questioning occurs.
The <fen>Investigator</fen> is the person or agency that investigates the <fen>Suspect</fen> of a crime (<fen>Incident</fen>).

The <fen>Investigator</fen> attempts to determine the exact circumstances surrounding the <fen>Incident</fen>, which is typically a criminal act (murder, robbery) or the result of such an act (death, loss of money).
This role denotes the <fen>Suspect</fen> that is investigated by the <fen>Investigator</fen>.
When the <fen>Investigator</fen> investigates the <fen>Incident</fen>.
With a target verb, the Cognizer is usually expressed as an External Argument, with the Topic appearing as an Object NP, a gerundive verbal Complement, or a PP.
With a target verb, the <fen>Topic</fen> is usually expressed as an Object NP, a gerundive verbal complement, or a PP.
The time at which the <fen>Cognizer</fen> considers the <fen>Topic</fen>.
The <fen>Cognizer</fen> pays attention to an entity in order to discover something about it. The role is normally expressed as an External Argument:

The <fen>Cognizer</fen> pays attention to the <fen>Ground</fen>, so named because it serves as the background or context for the <fen>Phenomenon</fen>. This role can be expressed as an NP Object or as a PP Complement.

The <fen>Medium</fen> is the piece of text or work in which the <fen>Cognizer</fen> pays attention to an entity in order to discover something about it. The role is normally expressed as an External Argument:
An entity directed by the <fen>Cognizer</fen>  that interacts with the <fen>Ground</fen> to accomplish the scrutiny.
The <fen>Time</fen> when the <fen>Cognizer</fen> is scrutinizing the <fen>Ground</fen>.
listRoleExamples: The jury deliberated <fex>his guilt</fex>.
The jury deliberated for three hours <fex>last Tuesday.</fex>.
The jury deliberated for several hours <fex>in the Oakland courthouse</fex>.
She's a <fex>French</fex> Teacher
She's Studying <fex>for a Master's degree</fex>
Taut with worry, Dad taught us <fex>how to drive</fex>.
My brother taught me <fex>not to be mean to guys when I'm not interested in them</fex>.
When I was two she taught me <fex>that a quarter was 25 cents and a dime was 10 cents</fex>.
All employees have received <fex>a booklet</fex> INSTRUCTING them on how to report ` anything from unwanted touching and uncalled-for blue jokes to overt demands for sexual favours . '
When his father died he went to live with an uncle in Ka'u who trained him <fex>as a warrior</fex> during his teenage years
<fex>Pat</fex> quizzed me about where I had been.
Pat questioned <fex>me</fex> about where I had been.
<fex>'What are you doing?'</fex> Kim inquired.
Pat inquired <fex>about train times</fex>.
I inquired <fex>yesterday</fex>.
The police are investigating <fex>Dr. Phil</fex>.
Our guys are <fex>currently</fex> investigating her disappearance.
<fex>Pat</fex> considered a career change.
Pat considered <fex>a career change</fex>.
<fex>Leslie</fex> examined the glass for cracks.
Leslie examined <fex>the glass</fex> for cracks.
<fex>Chapter four</fex> examined the case for free speech.
The temperature controller monitored the temperature <fex>with a calibrated silicon diode</fex>.
